priorVersion.title: SDTM Implementation Guide for Medical Devices SDTMIG-MD 1.0 (Provisional)

self.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

classes.description: The majority of observations collected during a study can be divided among three general classes: Interventions, Events, or Findings.  Datasets based on any of the general observation classes share a set of common Identifier and Timing variables. As a general rule, any valid Identifier or Timing variable is permissible for use in any submission dataset based on a general observation class. (Source: SDTM v1.7, Section 2.2)
classes.label: General Observation Class
classes.name: General Observations

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1
Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

datasets.datasetStructure: One record per recorded intervention occurrence or constant treatment interval per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DXSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier that ties together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. For example, if a device is inserted that delivers radiation, DXGRPID could be used to tie the records for the device and the radiation together for each course of therapy.
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: DXGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Examples: a number pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DXSPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Name of Device Exposure or Output

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXTRT

self.title: Name of Device Exposure or Output

datasetVariables.description: Name of the device or the exposure outputs that are delivered or administered via the device. This should match the definitions as described in the trial summary domain and/or the protocol. Example: "coronary stent", "extracorporeal shock wave treatment", "hyaluronic acid".
datasetVariables.label: Name of Device Exposure or Output
datasetVariables.name: DXTRT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a category of device exposures. For example, for a subject who had radiation delivered through an implanted catheter, DXCAT could be used to group the radiation records versus the catheter records.
datasetVariables.label: Category for Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of device exposures. If DXCAT captures the radiation versus catheter records (see DXCAT), then DXSCAT might capture the type of catheter if more than one was used.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXSCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSE

datasetVariables.description: Amount of DXTRT administered/delivered per administration. Dose if captured as a numeric value. Dose should only appear once in DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, or DXDOSTOT.
datasetVariables.label: Exposure per Administration
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSE

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSTXT

datasetVariables.description: Exposure amount or a range of exposure information collected in text form. Units may be stored in DXDOSU. Example: 200-400, 15-20. Dose should only appear once in DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, or DXDOSTOT.
datasetVariables.label: Device Exposure Description
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSTXT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSU

datasetVariables.description: Units for DXDOSE, DXDOSTXT, and DXDOSTOT. Examples: "pulses", "ml".
datasetVariables.label: Device Exposure Units
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSFRQ

datasetVariables.description: Exposure frequency per interval. Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of DXDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "CONTINUOUS", "PRN", "Q2M" (every 2 months).
datasetVariables.label: Device Exposure Frequency per Interval
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSFRQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSTOT

datasetVariables.description: Total daily exposure of DXTRT using the units in DXDOSU. Total exposure over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate Supplemental Qualifier variable.
datasetVariables.label: Total Daily Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSTOT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDOSRGM

datasetVariables.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: "TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF".
datasetVariables.label: Intended Device Exposure Regimen
datasetVariables.name: DXDOSRGM

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXROUTE

datasetVariables.description: Route of administration for DXTRT. Examples: "EXTRACORPOREAL", "INTRA-ARTICULAR, HEMODIALYSIS".
datasetVariables.label: Route of Administration
datasetVariables.name: DXROUTE

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXLOC

datasetVariables.description: Anatomic location of exposure. Examples: "Knee", "Eye".
datasetVariables.label: Location of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXLOC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXLAT

datasetVariables.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
datasetVariables.label: Laterality of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXLAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXADJ

datasetVariables.description: Describes reason why the exposure was adjusted from protocol-specified or expected exposure levels. Example: "PAIN".
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exposure Adjustment
datasetVariables.name: DXADJ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Start date and time of exposure. Defined by the sponsor.
datasetVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXENDTC

datasetVariables.description: End date and time of exposure. Defined by the sponsor.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXENDTC

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Start of Device Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXSTDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Device Exposure

datasetVariables.description: Study day of start of exposure relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXSTDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Study Day of End of Device Exposure

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXENDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Device Exposure

datasetVariables.description: Study day of end of exposure relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of End of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXENDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DX.DXDUR

datasetVariables.description: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariables.label: Duration of Device Exposure
datasetVariables.name: DXDUR

datasets.description: An interventions domain that contains a subject's exposure to a medical device under study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102617, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Exposure
datasets.name: DX

classes.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Interventions Observation Class
classes.name: Interventions

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1
Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

datasets.datasetStructure: One record per event per device

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Expected rather than required because events may happen to or with a device that do not involved subjects, and may even be before the device was in contact with a subject. In these cases there may not be a value for USUBJID.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination. If there is no USUBJID associated with the event, DESEQ should be unique within each SPDEVID.
datasetVariables.label: Device Events Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DESEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Note that it does not have to be numeric.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DESPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DETERM

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the observed event. Examples: "Screw Breakage", "Fissure Formation", "Battery Issue".
datasetVariables.label: Reported Term for Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DETERM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: The modified text for DETERM. If DETERM is modified, then the modified text is placed here.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Device Event Name
datasetVariables.name: DEMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Dictionary-derived form of the event described in DETERM. Dictionary-derived text description of DETERM or DEMODIFY. The name and version of the dictionary used to map terms must be provided in a Define.XML ExternalCodeList element.
datasetVariables.label: Device Events Dictionary-Derived Term
datasetVariables.name: DEDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DECAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a categorization level for events. For example, "MALFUNCTION" vs. "CALIBRATION".
datasetVariables.label: Category of Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DECAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to define a further category level for events. For example, "EXTERNAL" vs. "INTERNAL".
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory of Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DESCAT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEPRESP

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate whether (Y/null) information about a specific event was solicited on the CRF. For example, DETERM could contain a list of malfunctions that are being specifically evaluated. DEPRESP would identify those (Y), whereas any spontaneous events would have DEPREST null.
datasetVariables.label: Pre-Specified Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DEPRESP

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEOCCUR

datasetVariables.description: When information about specific events is solicited, DEOCCUR is used to indicate whether or not (Y/N) a particular pre-specified event occurred. Values are null for events not specifically solicited.
datasetVariables.label: Device Event Occurrence
datasetVariables.name: DEOCCUR

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESTAT

datasetVariables.description: The status indicates that the pre-specified question was not answered. For example, if equipment operation requires checking, such as checking an event log to detect events. Capturing that the checks were not completed may be relevant to interpreting the study data.
datasetVariables.label: Device Event Collection Status
datasetVariables.name: DESTAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEREASND

datasetVariables.description: Reason DESTAT was "NOT DONE". This variable should only be used if there are pre-specified events.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Device Event Not Collected
datasetVariables.name: DEREASND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESEV

datasetVariables.description: Describes the severity of the event, (e.g, the severity of a malfunction).
datasetVariables.label: Device Event Severity
datasetVariables.name: DESEV

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEACNDEV

datasetVariables.description: Describes Action Taken with respect to the device. Action Taken may include removal, calibration, reprogramming, and so on. Action is usually in response to some event, for example, a subject's adverse event.
datasetVariables.label: Action Taken with Device
datasetVariables.name: DEACNDEV

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Name
datasetVariables.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.VISITDY

datasetVariables.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. This value is usually derived.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariables.name: VISITDY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Date of Device Event Data Collection

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEDTC

self.title: Date of Device Event Data Collection

datasetVariables.description: Date the device event information was collected. This may be reported if the event (e.g., malfunction) is discovered on a different date from the event.
datasetVariables.label: Date of Device Event Data Collection
datasetVariables.name: DEDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Start date/time of the device event. If the event happened at a single point in time, DESTDTC is used.
datasetVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DESTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEENDTC

datasetVariables.description: End date/time of the device event. If an event lasted over a period of time, DEENDTC can be used to capture the end date/time.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Device Event
datasetVariables.name: DEENDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Device Event Data Collection

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEDY

self.title: Study Day of Start of Tracking Event

datasetVariables.description: Study day of Device Event observation, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DEDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Device Event Start Date/Time

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DESTDY

self.title: Study Day of Device Event Start

datasetVariables.description: Study day of start of Device Event, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Device Event Start
datasetVariables.name: DESTDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Study Day of Device Event End Date/Time

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DE.DEENDY

self.title: Study Day of Device Event End

datasetVariables.description: Study day of end of Device Event, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFENDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Device Event End
datasetVariables.name: DEENDY

datasets.description: An events domain that contains data for device-related events. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102616, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Events
datasets.name: DE

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records (if applicable) within a domain. May be any valid number. Should be unique within each SPDEVID.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DTSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Reported Term for the Tracking Event

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTTERM

self.title: Reported Term for the Tracking Event

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim or preprinted term for the activity that occurs. Example: "Shipped", "Returned", "Installed", "Implanted", "Explanted".
datasetVariables.label: Reported Term for the Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTTERM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTMODIFY

datasetVariables.description: Modified term entered to allow mapping of verbatim term to dictionary term. If DTTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then DTMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
datasetVariables.name: DTMODIFY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTDECOD

datasetVariables.description: Dictionary-derived text description of DTTERM or DTMODIFY. If an external controlled terminology is used, the name and version of the dictionary used to map terms must be provided in a Define-XML ExternalCodeList element.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Tracking Term
datasetVariables.name: DTDECOD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTCAT

datasetVariables.description: Defines a categorization level for a group of related records. Examples: categorize by tracking event type (e.g., "DOMESTIC" vs. "INTERNATIONAL").
datasetVariables.label: Category for Device Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTSCAT

datasetVariables.description: Defines a further categorization level for a group of related conditions or events.
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTSCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTPARTY

datasetVariables.description: Person or organization accountable for the device at the conclusion of the action specified in DTTERM. Describes the person or organization that is accountable for the device defined in DTTERM. For example, if DTTERM=SHIPPED, DTPARTY would contain the transfer recipient (e.g., SITE). If DTTERM=IMPLANTED, DTPARTY would contain SUBJECT.
datasetVariables.label: Party Responsible for the Device
datasetVariables.name: DTPARTY

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTPRTYID

datasetVariables.description: An identifier for the responsible group/role (e.g. site, subject). The value of the responsible party identified in DTPARTY. For example, if DTPARTY is SUBJECT, DTPRTYID would contain the subject number.
datasetVariables.label: Responsible Party Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DTPRTYID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Date/Time of Device Tracking Event Collection

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time the tracking event information was collected. Will generally be the same as the date the tracking event started, but it can differ.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Tracking Event Collection
datasetVariables.name: DTDTC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

priorVersion.title: Start Date/Time of Device Tracking Event

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DT.DTSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Start date/time of tracking event. A tracking event (e.g., SHIPPED, RECEIVED) is usually a point in time, which is why only the start date/time is included. If an event occurs over a longer period, the stop date/time may be included from the SDTM model.
datasetVariables.label: Start Date/Time of Tracking Event
datasetVariables.name: DTSTDTC

datasets.description: A events domain that contains the logistics and disposition information specific to a given device. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102621, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Tracking and Disposition
datasets.name: DT

classes.description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Events Observation Class
classes.name: Events

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1
Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

datasets.datasetStructure: One record per property or setting per time point per visit or test date per subject

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.

datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Expected in this domain as devices may have settings or uses that either may not involve subjects (e.g., diagnostic tools) or devices that are removed from the study prior to contact with a subject (e.g., device has malfunction).
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, or combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of device records within subject records within a domain. May be any valid number. It should be unique within every subject/device combination.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DUSEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier for a group or block of related records. Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject or a group of subject related records (e.g., group records specifying all the settings for a specific imaging scan, such as field strength, repetition time and echo time).
datasetVariables.label: Group ID
datasetVariables.name: DUGRPID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUREFID

datasetVariables.description: Internal or external identifier. This could be a scan code or equivalent.
datasetVariables.label: Reference ID
datasetVariables.name: DUREFID

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: DUSPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106483

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DUTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST"). DUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "COILSTR", "CNTMEDIA".
datasetVariables.label: Device-In-Use Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106482

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUTEST

datasetVariables.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in DUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Coil Strength", "Contrast Media".
datasetVariables.label: Device-In-Use Test Name
datasetVariables.name: DUTEST

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUCAT

datasetVariables.description: Defines a category of related records. It can be used to define the type of device for which settings are recorded if DI is not used (e.g., if the device is not under study); may also be used to record the type of setting (e.g., "HARDWARE" vs. "SOFTWARE").
datasetVariables.label: Category for Device-In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUCAT

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSCAT

datasetVariables.description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination. For example, if DUCAT = "SOFTWARE", DUSCAT might be "NOMINAL" or "POST-ADJUSTMENT".
datasetVariables.label: Subcategory for Device-In-Use
datasetVariables.name: DUSCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRES

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement as originally received or collected. DUORRES should contain the setting or other device condition in effect at the time the device was used.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUORRESU

datasetVariables.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for DUORRES. Examples: Tesla, mm.
datasetVariables.label: Original Units
datasetVariables.name: DUORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESC

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from DUORRES in a standard format or standard units. DUSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DUSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE," "NEG," and "NEGATIVE" in DUORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in DUSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESC

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format. Copied in numeric format from DUSTRESC. DUSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUSTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for DUSTRESC and DUSTRESN. The unit for standardized results may or may not be the same as for the original results.
datasetVariables.label: Standard Units
datasetVariables.name: DUSTRESU

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.VISITNUM

datasetVariables.description: A clinical encounter number. A Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Visit Number
datasetVariables.name: VISITNUM

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.VISIT

datasetVariables.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.

self.title: Date/Time Device Used with Test/ Setting

datasetVariables.description: Date/time that the device was used with this setting. This is not the date/time that the setting was set on the device, but rather that date/time that a measurement or test was done using that setting.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time Device Used with Test/ Setting
datasetVariables.name: DUDTC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DU.DUDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of Device-In-Use measurement, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Observation
datasetVariables.name: DUDY

datasets.description: A findings domain that contains the measurements and settings that are intentionally set on a device when it is in use. These are characteristics that exist for the device, and have a specific setting for a use instance. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102622, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device-In-Use

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain that contains the linkage of each subject to the device(s) to which they may have been exposed during the study. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102620, 2018-06-29)

classes.description: This SDTM class provides a means to link related records between datasets. It includes the RELREC and SUPPQUAL datasets. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103376, 2018-06-29)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.SPDEVID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for the device. It must be unique for each tracked unit of the device under study, and can be at whatever level of granularity the device should be identified (e.g., model or serial number, combination of identifiers).
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SPDEVID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DISEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter within a device (SPDEVID) within dataset. If there is only one value for DIPARMCD for each value of SPDEVID, then DISEQ will be 1 for all records. DISEQ must be a valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: DISEQ

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIPARMCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the identifier characteristic of the device (e.g., "SERIAL", "MODEL"). A record with DIPARMCD = "DEVTYPE" should be included (see below).
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier Element Short Name
datasetVariables.name: DIPARMCD

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIPARM

datasetVariables.description: Name of the identifier characteristic of the device. Examples: Serial Number, Model. A record with DIPARM = "DEVTYPE" should be included (see below).
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier Element Name
datasetVariables.name: DIPARM

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable DI.DIVAL

datasetVariables.description: Value for the parameter. Value for the parameter. When DIPARMCD=DEVTYPE it should use controlled terminology defined by FDA in their Preferred Term codelist. FDA has stated a preference for the Global Medical Device Nomenclature (GMDN), but as of the date of this publication, the GMDN is not freely available to the public. In its Unique Device Identification rule, FDA indicated that GMDN will not be required unless it is available to the public at no cost. There is a lookup tool on the FDA website to map GMDN codes to FDA PT codes.
datasetVariables.label: Device Identifier Element Value
datasetVariables.name: DIVAL

datasets.description: A special-purpose domain containing information that identifies a specific device unit. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102618, 2018-06-29)
datasets.label: Device Identifiers
datasets.name: DI

classes.description: This special purpose SDTM class contains further descriptions of study-specific identifiers that will be used in subject based domains. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C147271, 2018-06-29)
classes.label: Datasets for Study References
classes.name: Study Reference

description: This Medical Device Implementation Guide (IG) to the Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) defines recommended standards for the submission of data from clinical trials in which ,edical devices were used, and is referred to as the SDTMIG-MD.
label: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Medical Devices (SDTMIG-MD) Version 1.1
name: SDTMIG-MD v1.1
source: Prepared by the CDISC Device Team
